original: Section 1.  Promotion Services . Promoter to provide the following services to VNUE in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in this agreement:
ollama_generated:
Section 1. Service Obligations of the Promoter. The Promoter shall be under an obligation, within the parameters established by this agreement, to perform the following duties on behalf of VNUE:

This revision places the responsibility for providing services slightly more emphatically on the Promoter and subtly changes the tone from a statement into an obligation.

original: Three Million (3,000,000) shares of VNUE common stock shall be awarded to Promoter for performing Promotion Services as follows:
ollama_generated: Upon satisfactory completion and delivery of the Promotion Services by Promoter, a maximum of Three Million (3,000,000) shares of VNUE common stock may be issued at the discretion of VNUE, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

original: Source: VNUE, INC., 8-K, 9/14/2015 For every Five (5) music venues that sign a contract with VNUE, Six Hundred  Thousand (600,000) shares of VNUE common stock shall be awarded to Promoter; If Ten (10) music venues sign a contract with VNUE before January 16, 2016,  Promoter will receive an additional bonus of Three Hundred Thousand (300,000)  shares of VNUE common stock.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: VNUE, INC., 8-K, 9/14/2015 Promoter will be granted Six Hundred Thousand (600,000) shares of VNUE common stock for every Five (5) music venues that execute a contract with VNUE. If, within the specified timeframe before January 16, 2016, more than Ten (10) music venues have signed a contract with VNUE, VNUE reserves the right to award Promoter an additional bonus of Three Hundred Thousand (300,000) shares of its common stock at its sole discretion.

original: Section 5.  Place of Work . Promoter may perform the Promotion Services at such locations as Promoter may choose.
ollama_generated: Section 5. Location of Performance: The Performed Services by the Promotee may occur at various sites, as solely determined by the Promoter's discretion. However, the Promoter shall ensure that all necessary facilities and resources are made available to the Promotee for the timely and efficient completion of the Promotion Services.

original: Section 6.  Term. This Agreement shall commence on September 10, 2015 and shall continue for One (1) Year (the “Term”). At any time prior to the end of the Term, the Parties may agree in writing to extend the Agreement for successive One (1) Year periods (the “Renewal Terms”) under the same conditions set forth herein.
ollama_generated:
Section 6. Duration and Renewals. This Agreement shall commence on September 10, 2015 and persist for one year (the "Initial Term"). Upon expiration of the Initial Term, either Party may elect to renew this Agreement on a yearly basis, provided that written notice of intent to renew is given at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of each yearly period. The terms set forth herein shall remain in effect during the Renewal Terms unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both Parties. In the event of non-renewal or termination, any provisions relating to intellectual property rights, confidentiality, and indemnification shall continue to bind the Parties as per their original terms.

In this version, the Parties have the option to renew the agreement annually (as opposed to the original clause where the Parties could agree on an extension at any time prior to the end of the term). Additionally, each Party must give written notice at least 30 days before the end of each yearly period if they wish to renew. Lastly, I've added a sentence that specifies that certain provisions will remain binding even in cases of non-renewal or termination.

original: B.Promoter is an independent contractor acting in the limited capacity as an independent contractor for VNUE.
ollama_generated: B.VNUE acknowledges that Promoter functions as a third-party service provider, who acts at their own discretion and assumes full responsibility for their services rendered to VNUE.

original: C.Promoter will not disseminate or share with third parties any material information about VNUE not already contained in a Company report filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, as Promoter acknowledges that such third parties might try to act on such material non-public information by engaging in “insider trading” to the detriment of VNUE.
ollama_generated: D. Recipient acknowledges that they may possess material non-public information concerning VNUE, and agrees not to exploit this knowledge by indulging in insider trading activities. They are advised that any unauthorized disclosure of such information to third parties could potentially harm VNUE, and shall be held accountable for any resulting adverse effects. It is further clarified that the Recipient should only rely on Company reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for any material information regarding VNUE.

original: Section 11.  Enforceability . It is agreed between the parties that there are no other agreements or understandings between them relating to the subject matter of this agreement. This agreement supersedes all prior agreements, oral or written, between the parties and is intended as a complete and exclusive statement of the agreement between the parties. If any provision in this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, void or unenforceable, the remaining provisions will continue in full force without being impaired or invalidated in any Section 12.  Non-exclusion . It is understood that VNUE does not agree to use BookingEntertainment.com exclusively as its Promoter, and that Promoter shall not be held liable for the actions of third parties which may also be providing the same or similar services during the term of this Agreement. Likewise, Promoter is free to contract for services to be performed for other public and private companies while under contract with VNUE, subject to the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Section 11. Enforceability Adjustments: The parties acknowledge that there exist no side agreements or mutual understandings concerning the agreement's subject matter, except as explicitly stated within this document. This agreement effectively replaces any previous commitments, whether verbal or written, made by either party. However, should a court of appropriate jurisdiction deem a provision in this Agreement incompatible with law, this finding will not nullify or impair the remaining provisions, which shall continue to hold validity and full effect.

Section 12. Non-Exclusive Obligations: Both parties affirm that VNUE does not constrain itself to BookingEntertainment.com as its sole Promoter, and it is understood that BookingEntertainment.com shall not be held responsible for the conduct of third parties offering similar services during this Agreement's tenure. Conversely, VNUE acknowledges that the Promoter may engage with other clients, public or private, to perform services as per their mutual agreement, provided these activities do not violate the terms outlined in this Agreement.

original: Section 15.  Execution . This Agreement may be executed via facsimile and in counterparts, which together shall constitute the single Agreement.
ollama_generated: Section 15. Execution. Each party may execute this Agreement electronically or by facsimile, with such individual executions being considered separate but collectively binding parts of the entire Agreement. No single part shall be deemed invalid if not physically signed by all parties; rather, the Agreement shall remain valid and enforceable upon the execution of a sufficient number of parts by the requisite number of parties.

original: WHEREFORE , the parties have executed this Promotion Agreement as of the date written above.
ollama_generated: IN CONSEQUENCE, the parties acknowledge and consent to the binding nature of this Promotion Agreement, effective from the date duly recorded herein.
